channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overflowing public bins, 10th February
item.description:
These bins are like that since 4 days. Please act.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Gayhurst Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant fly tipping issue, 10th February
item.description:
This issue has been reported several times and has never been fixed. Mountains of waste are accumulated on the public pavement obstructing the passage and posing a health risk for the local community.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oakley Place, Old Kent Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lazy car parking during school run..., 10th February
item.description:
No consideration for pedestrians, even with a path around it, not appropriate on a corner restricting views for people wishing to cross. There has been a marked deterioration of both parking and driving around the Haileybury Turnford Secondary and Brooklands Primary schools during drop-off and pick-up times. Drivers parking wherever they want with little regard to pedestrians and frequently driving on the pavement on Mill Lane, even whilst being used by pedestrians, some of whom are of school age. The impatience of drivers also manifests itself with fast accelerations, inappropriate speeds and a general attitude of aggressiveness.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ashdown Crescent, Cheshunt
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Enormous pothole and debris on pavement, 10th February
item.description:
That this has been allowed to happen on a major road in central London is beyond comprehension. Especially considering this is a very dangerous cycle route / bus lane that is already dangerous as it is. The pothole is so big that there is debris on the pavement. Ut needs to be fixed as a matter of urgency.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 57, Clerkenwell Road, Clerkenwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two dead horses dumped in a reed bed tied up in bags., 10th February
item.description:

item.title: Littering urine and upkeep, 10th February
item.description:
Walking carefully with my 5 year old so he doesn’t trip and fall the stairwell is very dirty and there’s a large puddle of urine. As we got to the parade where Paddy Power is a homeless man was emptying his rubbish into the planter behind where he was pitched up. The hairdresser owner was clearly upset to see him doing this. It makes the cut through and stairs very unpleasant to use especially on these dark cold evenings.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
